author: Staff Reporter
text:
Four days after traders protested against Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Finance Minister Arun Jaitley in Meerut, as many as 150 of them have been booked for allegedly smearing black ink and throwing eggs at the posters of the PM and Mr. Jaitley.

Different parts of western Uttar Pradesh including Meerut witnessed protests against the Central government for the fresh levy of one percent excise duty on non-silver jewellery.

Trade leaders like Rajkumar Bharadwaj, General Secretary of the Meerut Bullion Traders Association, and Survesh Kumar Saraf were named in the FIR registered on Sunday under IPC Sections 147 (rioting), 341 (wrongful restraint) and 505 (public mischief).
title: 150 U.P. traders booked for vandalising Modi, Jaitley posters
